arabicText: وَٱلْأَرْضَ مَدَدْنَـٰهَا وَأَلْقَيْنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَأَنۢبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوْجٍۭ بَهِيجٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	(how)	We	have	spread	the	earth,	and	
placed	mountains	as	anchors	in	it,	and	have	
grown	all	kinds	of	beautiful	pairs	in	it?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	ko	hum	ne	phailāya	aur	us	
meiñ	langar	dāle	aur	us	meiñ	har	ba
raunaq		jorda	ugāya.

arabicText: تَبْصِرَةًۭ وَذِكْرَىٰ لِكُلِّ عَبْدٍۢ مُّنِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
A	perception	and	an	understanding,	for	
every	bondman	who	inclines.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Soojh	aur	samajh	har	ruju'	wāle	bande	ke	
liye

arabicText: وَنَزَّلْنَا مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءًۭ مُّبَـٰرَكًۭا فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَحَبَّ ٱلْحَصِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	sent	down	the	auspicious	water	from	the	sky,	therefore	producing	gardens	with	it,	and	
the	grain	that	is	harvested.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Hum	ne	āasmān	se	barkat	wāla	pāni	utāra	to	us	se	bāgh	ugāaye	aur	anāj	ke	kāta	jāta	hai

arabicText: وَٱلنَّخْلَ بَاسِقَـٰتٍۢ لَّهَا طَلْعٌۭ نَّضِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText: And	high	date-palms	with	lush	fruit.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	khajoor	ke	lambe	darakht	jin	ka	pakka	gābha	(Pakā	huwa	tāzā	phal)	.

arabicText: رِّزْقًۭا لِّلْعِبَادِ ۖ وَأَحْيَيْنَا بِهِۦ بَلْدَةًۭ مَّيْتًۭا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلْخُرُوجُ
englishTranslationText: As	sustenance	for	the	bondmen;	and	with	it	We	revived	a	dead	city;	this	is	how	you	will	be	raised.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Bandoñ	ki	rozi	ke	liye	aur	hum	ne	us	se	murda	(Wirān)	shaher	jilaya	(Sar	sabz	kiya)	yuñ	hi	qabroñ	
se	tumhāra	nikalna	hai

arabicText: كَذَّبَتْ قَبْلَهُمْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍۢ وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلرَّسِّ وَثَمُودُ
englishTranslationText: Before	these,	the	people	of	Nooh	had	denied,	and	so	did	the	dwellers	of	Rass	and	the	Thamud.
romanUrduTranslationText: In	se	pehle	jhutlāya	Nūh	ki	qaum	aur	ras	waloñ	aur	Samood

arabicText: وَعَادٌۭ وَفِرْعَوْنُ وَإِخْوَٰنُ لُوطٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	the	tribe	of	A’ad,	and	Firaun,	and	the	fellowmen	of	Lut.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Āad	aur	fir'aun	aur	Lūt	ke	hum	qaumoñ.

arabicText: وَأَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأَيْكَةِ وَقَوْمُ تُبَّعٍۢ ۚ كُلٌّۭ كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ وَعِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Dwellers	of	the	Woods,	and	the	people	of	Tubb’a;	each	one	of	them	one	denied	the	Noble	
Messengers,	so	My	promised	punishment	proved	true.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jangal	waloñ	aur	Tubba'	ki	qaum	ne	un	meiñ	har	ek	ne	Rasooloñ	ko	jhutlāya	to	mere	‘aƶāb		
ka	w’ada	sābit	ho	gaya

arabicText: أَفَعَيِينَا بِٱلْخَلْقِ ٱلْأَوَّلِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى لَبْسٍۢ مِّنْ خَلْقٍۢ جَدِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText: So	did	We	tire	by	creating	the	first	time?	Rather	they	doubt	in	being	created	again.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	kya	hum	pehli	bār	bana	kar	thak	gaye	balke	woh	naye	banne	se	shub	he	meiñ	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ وَنَعْلَمُ مَا تُوَسْوِسُ بِهِۦ نَفْسُهُۥ ۖ وَنَحْنُ أَقْرَبُ إِلَيْهِ مِنْ حَبْلِ ٱلْوَرِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	We	have	created	man	and	We	
know	what	his	soul	instils	in	him;	and	We	
are	nearer	to	him	than	the	heart’s	artery.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		hum	ne	āadmi	ko	paida	kiya	
aur	hum	jānte	haiñ	jo	waswasā	uska	nafs	
dālta	hai	aur	hum	dil	ki	rag	se	bhi	us	se	
ziyada	nazdeek	haiñ

arabicText: إِذْ يَتَلَقَّى ٱلْمُتَلَقِّيَانِ عَنِ ٱلْيَمِينِ وَعَنِ ٱلشِّمَالِ قَعِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
When	the	two	receiving	angels	receive	
from	him,	one	seated	on	the	right	and	one	
on	the	left.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jab	us	se	lete	haiñ	do	lene	wāle	ek	dāhine	
baitha	aur	ek	bāayeñ

arabicText: مَّا يَلْفِظُ مِن قَوْلٍ إِلَّا لَدَيْهِ رَقِيبٌ عَتِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
He	does	not	utter	a	single	word,	without	a	
ready	recorder	seated	next	to	him.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Koi	bāt	woh	zubān	se	nahi	nikālta	ke	uske	
pās	ek	muhāfiz	tayyār	na	baitha	ho

arabicText: وَجَآءَتْ سَكْرَةُ ٱلْمَوْتِ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ مَا كُنتَ مِنْهُ تَحِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	hardship	of	death	came	with	the	truth;	
“This	is	what	you	were	escaping	from!”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	āayi	maut	ki	sakhti	haq	ke	sāth	yeh	hai	
jis	se	tu	bhāgta	tha

arabicText: وَجَآءَتْ كُلُّ نَفْسٍۢ مَّعَهَا سَآئِقٌۭ وَشَهِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	Trumpet	was	blown;	“This	is	the	
Day	of	the	promised	punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	Soor	phooñka	gaya	yeh	hai	w’ada-e
áƶāb	ka	din

arabicText: لَّقَدْ كُنتَ فِى غَفْلَةٍۢ مِّنْ هَـٰذَا فَكَشَفْنَا عَنكَ غِطَآءَكَ فَبَصَرُكَ ٱلْيَوْمَ حَدِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	every	soul	came,	along	with	a	herder	
and	a	witness.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	har	jān	yuñ	hāzir	huyi	ke	uske	sāth	ek	
hāñkne	wāla	aur	ek	gawah

arabicText: وَقَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ هَـٰذَا مَا لَدَىَّ عَتِيدٌ ٢٣
englishTranslationText:
“You	were	indeed	neglectful	of	this,	so	We	
have	removed	the	veil	for	you,	and	your	
eyesight	is	sharp	this	day.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		tu	is	se	ghaflat	meiñ	tha	to	hum	ne	
tujh	par	se	parda	uthaya	to	āaj	teri	nigah	
tez	hai

arabicText: أَلْقِيَا فِى جَهَنَّمَ كُلَّ كَفَّارٍ عَنِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	his	accompanying	angel	said,	“This	is	the	
record	of	your	deeds,	available	with	me.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	uska	hum-nasheen	firishta	bola	yeh	
hai	jo	mere	pās	hāzir	hai	ḥukm		hoga

arabicText: مَّنَّاعٍۢ لِّلْخَيْرِ مُعْتَدٍۢ مُّرِيبٍ
englishTranslationText:
It	will	be	said	to	the	angels,	“Both	of	you	
fling	every	excessive	ungrateful,	stubborn	
person	into	hell.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	donoñ	Jahannam	meiñ	dāl	do	har	
bade	na-shukre	hat	dharm	ko

arabicText: ٱلَّذِى جَعَلَ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَـٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَأَلْقِيَاهُ فِى ٱلْعَذَابِ ٱلشَّدِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
“The	one	who	excessively	prevented	from	
virtue,	the	transgressor,	the	doubtful.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jo	bhalāyi	se	bahut	rokne	wāla	had	se	badh	
ne	wāla	shak	karne	wāla

arabicText: ۞ قَالَ قَرِينُهُۥ رَبَّنَا مَآ أَطْغَيْتُهُۥ وَلَـٰكِن كَانَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍۭ بَعِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“The	one	who	appointed	another	God	
along	with	Allah	–	so	both	of	you	fling	him	
into	the	severe	punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	ne	Allah	ke	sāth	koi	aur	ma'bood	
thehrāya	tum	donoñ	usey	sakht	‘aƶāb		
meiñ	dālo

arabicText: قَالَ لَا تَخْتَصِمُوا۟ لَدَىَّ وَقَدْ قَدَّمْتُ إِلَيْكُم بِٱلْوَعِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
His	accompanying	devil	said,	“Our	Lord!	I	did	not	cause	him	to	rebel,	but	he	himself	was	in	
extreme	error.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Uske	sāthi	shaitān	ne	kahā	hamāre	Rab	
maiñ	ne	isey	sarkash	na	kiya	hāñ	yeh	āap	hi	door	ki	gumrahi	meiñ	tha

arabicText: مَا يُبَدَّلُ ٱلْقَوْلُ لَدَىَّ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ بِظَلَّـٰمٍۢ لِّلْعَبِيدِ
englishTranslationText: He	will	say,	“Do	not	dispute	before	Me	–	I	had	already	warned	you	of	the	punishment.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Farmāye	ga	mere	pās	na	jhagdo	maiñ	tumheiñ		pehle	hi	‘aƶāb		ka	dar	suna	chuka	tha

arabicText: يَوْمَ نَقُولُ لِجَهَنَّمَ هَلِ ٱمْتَلَأْتِ وَتَقُولُ هَلْ مِن مَّزِيدٍۢ
englishTranslationText: “With	Me,	the	decree	does	not	change,	and	nor	do	I	oppress	the	bondmen.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Mere	yahāñ		bāt	badalti	nahi	aur	na	maiñ	bandoñ	par	zulm	karuñ.

arabicText: وَأُزْلِفَتِ ٱلْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ
englishTranslationText: The	day	when	We	will	ask	hell,	“Are	you	filled	up?”	and	it	will	answer,	“Are	there	some	more?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jis	din	hum	Jahannm	se	farmāyeñ	ge	kya	tu	bhar	gayi	woh	‘arz	karegi	kuchh	aur	ziyada	hai

arabicText: هَـٰذَا مَا تُوعَدُونَ لِكُلِّ أَوَّابٍ حَفِيظٍۢ
englishTranslationText: And	Paradise	will	be	brought	close	to	the	pious,	not	far	away	from	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pās	lāyi	jāye	gi	jannat	parhez-gāroñ	ke	ke	un	se	door	na	hogi

arabicText: مَّنْ خَشِىَ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنَ بِٱلْغَيْبِ وَجَآءَ بِقَلْبٍۢ مُّنِيبٍ
englishTranslationText: This	is	what	you	are	promised	–	for	every	repenting,	careful	person.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yeh	hai	woh	jiska	tum	w’ada	diye	jāte	ho	har	ruju’	lāne	wāle	nigeh	dāsht	wāle	ke	liye

arabicText: ٱدْخُلُوهَا بِسَلَـٰمٍۢ ۖ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُلُودِ
englishTranslationText: Who	fears	the	Most	Gracious	without	seeing,	and	came	with	a	heart	that	inclines.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	Rahmān	se	be	dekhe	darta	hai	aur	ruju’	karta	huwa	dil	lāya

arabicText: لَهُم مَّا يَشَآءُونَ فِيهَا وَلَدَيْنَا مَزِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText: It	will	be	said	to	him,	“Enter	it	in	peace;	this	is	the	day	of	eternity.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	se	farmāya	jāyega	Jannat	meiñ	jāo	salāmati	ke	sāth	yeh	hameshgi	ka	din	hai

arabicText: وَكَمْ أَهْلَكْنَا قَبْلَهُم مِّن قَرْنٍ هُمْ أَشَدُّ مِنْهُم بَطْشًۭا فَنَقَّبُوا۟ فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ هَلْ مِن مَّحِيصٍ
englishTranslationText: In	it	for	them	is	all	that	they	may	desire,	and	with	Us	is	more	than	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Unke	liye	hai	is	meiñ	jo	chāheñ	aur	hamāre	pās	is	se	bhi	ziyada	hai.

arabicText: إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَذِكْرَىٰ لِمَن كَانَ لَهُۥ قَلْبٌ أَوْ أَلْقَى ٱلسَّمْعَ وَهُوَ شَهِيدٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	many	a	generation	We	did	destroy	
before	them,	who	exceeded	them	in	
strength,	therefore	venturing	in	the	cities!	
Is	there	a	place	to	escape?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	un	se	pehle	hum	ne	kitni	sangateiñ	
(Qaumeiñ)	halāk	farmā	deiñ	ke	giraft	meiñ	
un	se	sakht	thiñ	to	shehroñ	meiñ	
kawisheiñ	kiñ	hai	kahiñ	bhāgne	ki	jagah?

arabicText: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَا ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍۢ وَمَا مَسَّنَا مِن لُّغُوبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	in	this	is	an	advice	for	anyone	who	
keeps	a	heart,	or	listens	attentively.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		is	meiñ	nasihat	hai	uske	liye	jo	dil	
rakhta	ho	ya	kān	lagaye	aur	mutawajje	ho.

arabicText: فَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِ رَبِّكَ قَبْلَ طُلُوعِ ٱلشَّمْسِ وَقَبْلَ ٱلْغُرُوبِ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	have	indeed	created	the	heavens	
and	the	earth,	and	all	what	is	between	
them,	in	six	days;	and	fatigue	did	not	even	
approach	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	be-shak		hum	ne	āasmānoñ	aur	
zameen	ko	aur	jo	kuchh	in	ke	darmiyān	hai	
chhe	din	meiñ	banaya	aur	takān	hamāre	
pās	na	āayi

arabicText: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيْلِ فَسَبِّحْهُ وَأَدْبَـٰرَ ٱلسُّجُودِ
englishTranslationText:
Therefore	(O	dear	prophet	Muhammad	–	
peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him)	patiently	
bear	upon	what	they	say,	and	praising	your	
Lord	say	His	Purity	before	the	sun	rises	
and	before	the	sun	sets.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	unki	bātoñ	par	sabr	karo	aur	apne	Rab	
ki	t’areef	karte	huwe	uski	pāki	bolo	sooraj	
chamakne	se	pehle	aur	doobne	se	pehle

arabicText: وَٱسْتَمِعْ يَوْمَ يُنَادِ ٱلْمُنَادِ مِن مَّكَانٍۢ قَرِيبٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	say	His	Purity	during	the	night,	and	
after	the	customary	prayers.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kuchh	rāt	gaye	uski	tasbeeh	karo	aur	
Namāzoñ	ke	b’ad

arabicText: يَوْمَ يَسْمَعُونَ ٱلصَّيْحَةَ بِٱلْحَقِّ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ يَوْمُ ٱلْخُرُوجِ
englishTranslationText:
And	listen	attentively	on	the	day	when	an	
announcer	will	proclaim	from	a	place	
nearby.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kān	laga	kar	suno	jis	din	pukārne	wāla	
pukāre	ga	ek	pās	jagah	se

arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
The	day	when	all	will	hear	the	Scream	with	
the	truth;	this	is	the	day	of	coming	out	of	
the	graves.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	chinghārd	suneñ	ge	haq	ke	sāth	yeh	
din	hai	qabroñ	se	bāhar	āane	ka.

arabicText: إِنَّا نَحْنُ نُحْىِۦ وَنُمِيتُ وَإِلَيْنَا ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	it	is	We	Who	give	life,	and	give	
death,	and	towards	Us	only	is	the	return.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak	hum	jilayeñ	aur	hum	māreñ	aur	
hamāri	taraf	phirna	hai

arabicText: يَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ ٱلْأَرْضُ عَنْهُمْ سِرَاعًۭا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ حَشْرٌ عَلَيْنَا يَسِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
On	the	day	when	the	earth	will	split	for	
them,	so	they	will	come	out	in	haste;	this	is	
the	gathering	-	easy	for	Us.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Jis	din	zameen	un	se	phategi	to	jaldi	karte	
huwe	nikleñge	yeh	hashr	hai	hum	ko	
āasān.

arabicText: نَّحْنُ أَعْلَمُ بِمَا يَقُولُونَ ۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ عَلَيْهِم بِجَبَّارٍۢ ۖ فَذَكِّرْ بِٱلْقُرْءَانِ مَن يَخَافُ وَعِيدِ
englishTranslationText:
We	well	know	what	they	say	(O	dear	
Prophet	Muhammad	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him),	and	you	are	not	one	to	use	force	over	
them;	therefore	advise	him	with	the	Qur’an,	whoever	fears	My	threat.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Hum	khoob	jān	rahe	haiñ	jo	woh	keh	rahe	
haiñ	aur	kuchh	tum	un	par	jabr	karne	wāle	
nahi	to	Qur’ān	se	nasihat	karo	usey	jo	meri	
dhamki	se	dare.

arabicText: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَـٰتِ ذَرْوًۭا
englishTranslationText: By	oath	of	those	which	carry	away	while	dispersing.
romanUrduTranslationText: Qasam	unki	jo	bikher	kar	udāne	wāliyañ

arabicText: فَٱلْحَـٰمِلَـٰتِ وِقْرًۭا
englishTranslationText: Then	by	oath	of	those	which	carry	the	burdens.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	bojh	uthāne	wāliyañ

arabicText: فَٱلْجَـٰرِيَـٰتِ يُسْرًۭا
englishTranslationText: Then	by	oath	of	those	which	move	with	ease.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	naram	chalne	wāliyañ

arabicText: فَٱلْمُقَسِّمَـٰتِ أَمْرًا
englishTranslationText: Then	by	oath	of	those	which	distribute	by	the	command.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	ḥukm	se	bāñtne	wāliyañ

arabicText: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٌۭ
englishTranslationText: Undoubtedly,	the	promise	you	are	given	is	surely	true.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	jis	bāt	ka	tumheiñ	w’ada	diya	jāta	hai	zaroor	sach	hai

arabicText: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٌۭ
englishTranslationText: And	undoubtedly	justice	will	surely	be	done.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	insāf	zaroor	hona

arabicText: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلْحُبُكِ
englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	decorated	heaven.
romanUrduTranslationText: Āarāish	wāle	āasmān	ki	qasam

arabicText: إِنَّكُمْ لَفِى قَوْلٍۢ مُّخْتَلِفٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
You	are	indeed	in	different	opinions	
regarding	this	Qur’an.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	mukhtalif	bāt	meiñ	ho

arabicText: يُؤْفَكُ عَنْهُ مَنْ أُفِكَ
englishTranslationText:
Only	those	who	are	destined	to	revert,	are	
reverted	from	it.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Is	Qur’ān	se	wohi	auñdha	kiya	jāta	hai	jiski	
qismat	hi	meiñ	auñdhaya	jāna	ho

arabicText: قُتِلَ ٱلْخَرَّٰصُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Slain	be	those	who	mould	from	their	
imaginations.
romanUrduTranslationText: Māre	jāyeñ	dil	se	tarāshne wāle.

arabicText: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمْ فِى غَمْرَةٍۢ سَاهُونَ
englishTranslationText:
Those	who	have	forgotten	in	a	state	of	
intoxication.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	nashe	meiñ	bhoole	huwe	haiñ

arabicText: يَسْـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوْمُ ٱلدِّينِ
englishTranslationText:
They	ask,	“When	will	be	the	Day	of	
Judgement?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Poochhte	haiñ	insāf	ka	din	kab	hoga

arabicText: يَوْمَ هُمْ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفْتَنُونَ
englishTranslationText:
It	will	be	on	the	day	when	they	will	be	
roasted	in	the	fire.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	din	hoga	jis	din	woh	āag		par	tapāaye	
jāyeñ	ge

arabicText: ذُوقُوا۟ فِتْنَتَكُمْ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	it	will	be	said	to	them,	“Taste	your	own	
roasting;	this	is	what	you	were	impatient	for.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	farmāya	jāyega	chakho	apna	tapna	yeh	
hai	woh	jiski	tumheiñ		jaldi	thi

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱلْمُتَّقِينَ فِى جَنَّـٰتٍۢ وَعُيُونٍ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	the	pious	are	among	Gardens	and	
water	springs.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Be-shak		parhez-gār	bāghoñ	aur	chashmoñ	
meiñ	haiñ

arabicText: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمْ رَبُّهُمْ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَبْلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحْسِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Accepting	the	rewards	given	by	their	Lord;	
they	were	indeed	virtuous	before	this.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Apne	Rab	ki	ataayeiñ	lete	huwe	be-shak		woh	
is	se	pehle	neko-kār	they.

arabicText: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًۭا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText:
They	used	to	sleep	only	a	little	during	the	
night.
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	rāt	meiñ	kam	soya	karte

arabicText: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًۭا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	used	to	seek	forgiveness	before	dawn.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pichhli	rāt	istighfār	karte

arabicText: كَانُوا۟ قَلِيلًۭا مِّنَ ٱلَّيْلِ مَا يَهْجَعُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	used	to	seek	forgiveness	before	dawn.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	pichhli	rāt	istighfār	karte

arabicText: وَبِٱلْأَسْحَارِ هُمْ يَسْتَغْفِرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	the	beggar	and	the	destitute	had	a	share	
in	their	wealth.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	unke	māloñ	meiñ	haq	tha mañgtā	aur	
be-naseeb	ka

arabicText: وَفِىٓ أَمْوَٰلِهِمْ حَقٌّۭ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلْمَحْرُومِ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	the	earth	are	signs	for	those	who	are	
certain.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	zameen	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	yaqeen	
waloñ		ko

arabicText: وَفِى ٱلْأَرْضِ ءَايَـٰتٌۭ لِّلْمُوقِنِينَ
englishTranslationText:
And	in	your	own	selves;	so	can	you	not	
perceive?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	khud	tum	meiñ	to	kya	tumheiñ	soojhta	
nahi.

arabicText: وَفِىٓ أَنفُسِكُمْ ۚ أَفَلَا تُبْصِرُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	in	the	heaven	lies	your	sustenance,	and	the	promise	you	are	given.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āsmān	meiñ	tumhāra	rizq	hai	aur	jo	tumheiñ	w’ada	diya	jāta	hai

arabicText: وَفِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزْقُكُمْ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
englishTranslationText: And	in	the	heaven	lies	your	sustenance,	and	the	promise	you	are	given.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	āsmān	meiñ	tumhāra	rizq	hai	aur	jo	tumheiñ	w’ada	diya	jāta	hai

arabicText: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقٌّۭ مِّثْلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمْ تَنطِقُونَ
englishTranslationText:
So	by	oath	of	the	Lord	of	the	heavens	and	the	earth,	this	Qur’an	is	the	Truth,	in	the	same	language	
that	you	speak.
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	āasmān	aur	zameen	ke	Rab	ki	qasam	be-shak	yeh	Qur’ān	haq	hai	waisi	hi	zubān	meiñ	jo	tum	
bolte	ho.

arabicText: هَلْ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيْفِ إِبْرَٰهِيمَ ٱلْمُكْرَمِينَ
englishTranslationText:
Did	the	news	of	Ibrahim’s	honourable	guests	reach	you	(O dear Prophet Muhammad - peace and 
blessings be upon him)?
romanUrduTranslationText: Aey	Mehboob	Kya	tumhāre	pās	Ibraheem	ke	Mu'azzaz	Mehmānoñ	ki	khabar	āayi

arabicText: إِذْ دَخَلُوا۟ عَلَيْهِ فَقَالُوا۟ سَلَـٰمًۭا ۖ قَالَ سَلَـٰمٌۭ قَوْمٌۭ مُّنكَرُونَ
englishTranslationText:
When	they	came	to	him	and	said,	“Peace”;	he	answered,	“Peace”;	and	thought,	“These	people	are	
not	familiar.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	woh	uske	pās	āakar	bole	Salām	kahā	salām	na-shanāsa	log	haiñ

arabicText: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجْلٍۢ سَمِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: Then	he	went	to	his	home	-	so	he	brought	a	healthy	calf.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	apne	ghar	gayā	to	ek	farba	bachhda	le	āaya

arabicText: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِمْ قَالَ أَلَا تَأْكُلُونَ
englishTranslationText: He	then	presented	it	before	them	and	said,	“Do	you	not	eat?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	usey	unke	pās	rakha	kahā	kya	tum	khāte	nahi

arabicText: فَأَوْجَسَ مِنْهُمْ خِيفَةًۭ ۖ قَالُوا۟ لَا تَخَفْ ۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَـٰمٍ عَلِيمٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
He	therefore	inwardly	sensed	fear	of	them;	they	said,	“Do	not	fear!”;	and	they	gave	him	the	glad	
tidings	of	a	knowledgeable	son.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	apne	jee	meiñ	un	se	darne	lagā	woh	bole	dairye	nahi	aur	usey	ek	‘ilm	wāle	ladke	ki	basharat	di.

arabicText: فَأَقْبَلَتِ ٱمْرَأَتُهُۥ فِى صَرَّةٍۢ فَصَكَّتْ وَجْهَهَا وَقَالَتْ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText: So	his	wife	came	screaming,	and	striking	her	forehead	cried,	“What!	For	a	barren	old	woman?”
romanUrduTranslationText: Is	par	uski	bibi	chillāti	āayi	phir	apna	mātha	thoñka	aur	boli	kya	budhiya	bānjh

arabicText: قَالُوا۟ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِ ۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلْحَكِيمُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
englishTranslationText: They	said,	“This	is	how	your	Lord	has	decreed;	indeed	He	only	is	the	Wise,	the	All	Knowing.”
romanUrduTranslationText: Unhoñ	ne	kahā	tumhāre	Rab	ne	yuñhi	farma	diya	hai	aur	wohi	hakeem	dāna	hai.
